questions.explanation: Raja Parba is a traditional Odia festival marking the beginning of the new rice crop. It begins with Pohela Boita Bondhu, a festival of boat racing and boating.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: When does Raja Parba usually start in Odisha?
questions.explanation: Raja Parba usually starts on the second day of the bright fortnight of the month of Poush, which corresponds to late December or early January in the Gregorian calendar.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which part of Odisha is known for being the epicenter of Raja Parba?
questions.explanation: Raja Parba is predominantly celebrated in the coastal districts of Odisha, with Puri being the epicenter of the festival.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Who is the Head of the Executive in the Government of India?
questions.explanation: The Prime Minister of India is the Head of the Executive in the Government of India. The Prime Minister is appointed by the President and is responsible for heading the Council of Ministers. The Prime Minister is the chief advisor to the President and is responsible for the overall direction and administration of the country.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Who appoints the Prime Minister of India?
questions.explanation: The President of India appoints the Prime Minister of India. The President appoints the leader of the party or coalition with the majority in the Lok Sabha as the Prime Minister. The President formally inquires of the leaders of the parties in the Lok Sabha and invites the leader of the party or coalition with the majority to form the government.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Who is the constitutional head of the Council of Ministers in India?
questions.explanation: The Prime Minister of India is the constitutional head of the Council of Ministers in India. The Prime Minister is responsible for the formation and the general administration of the Council of Ministers, and all the ministers are collectively responsible to the Lok Sabha.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Choose the correct option with proper use of the idiomatic expression.

options.A: The new policy will be put into effect from next week
options.B: The new policy will be put into practice from next week
options.C: The new policy will be put into operation from next week
options.D: The new policy will be put into effectuation from next week

questions.explanation: The idiomatic expression 'put into practice' is used to indicate the implementation or enforcement of a new rule or policy.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Select the option that uses the word 'inconsiderate' correctly.

options.A: The inconsiderate driver caused an accident because he was driving too fast
options.B: The inconsiderate driver caused an accident because he was driving too slow
options.C: The considerate driver caused an accident because he was driving too fast
options.D: The considerate driver caused an accident because he was driving too slow

questions.explanation: The word 'inconsiderate' refers to a person who is thoughtless or unkind in their actions or behavior. In this sentence, the inconsiderate driver is the one who caused the accident because he was driving too fast.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Choose the correct option with proper use of the word 'peruse' and its meaning.

options.A: Please peruse the entire report before presenting it
options.B: Please skim the entire report before presenting it
options.C: Please glance over the entire report before presenting it
options.D: Please read the entire report before presenting it

questions.explanation: The word 'peruse' means to read or examine something carefully and thoroughly. In this sentence, it is appropriate to use 'peruse' to indicate that one should carefully read the entire report before presenting it.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Who was the founder of the Gajapati Dynasty in Odisha?
questions.explanation: Narasimha Deva I (1288-1434 CE) was the founder of the Gajapati Dynasty in Odisha. He was a powerful ruler who established the dynasty and expanded its territories.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: What was the capital of the Gajapati Dynasty during the reign of Kapilendra Dev?
questions.explanation: Kapilendra Dev, the second ruler of the Gajapati Dynasty, shifted the capital from Puri to Kataka (modern-day Cuttack) to consolidate his power and make it a more secure location.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which of the following was a notable achievement of the Gajapati Dynasty?

options.A: Establishment of the Jagannath Temple in Puri
options.D: Exploration of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands

questions.explanation: The Gajapati Dynasty is known for its remarkable architectural contributions, including the construction of the Konark Sun Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, during the reign of Narasimha Deva I.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: What is the primary difference between simple interest (SI) and compound interest (CI) in calculating interest on an investment?

options.A: Compound interest is calculated at the end of the investment period, while simple interest is calculated at the beginning.
options.B: Simple interest is calculated at the end of the investment period, while compound interest is calculated at the beginning.
options.C: Compound interest takes into account the interest accrued on the principal amount, whereas simple interest does not.
options.D: The interest rate for compound interest is always higher than that for simple interest.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. Compound interest takes into account the interest accrued on the principal amount over time, whereas simple interest does not. This is because compound interest is calculated on both the principal amount and the accrued interest, resulting in a higher total amount at the end of the investment period.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: Suppose you deposit 8,000 at a 10% annual interest rate for one year. Which of the following scenarios represents the difference between simple interest and compound interest?
questions.explanation: Suppose we calculate the interest on the principal amount (8,000) for one year at an interest rate of 10%. Simple interest = 8,000 * (10/100) = 800. For compound interest, the interest is compounded annually: 8,000 * (1 + 10/100) = 8,800. Interest for the year = 8,800 - 8,000 = 800. Now, the 800 interest is added to the principal amount for the next year, making the principal amount 8,800. So, compound interest for the next year = 8,800 * (10/100) = 880. The total amount at the end of the second year is 8,800 + 880 = 9,680. Simple interest for two years would be 800 * 2 = 1,600. Thus, compound interest for two years is 9,680 - 8,000 = 1,680. However, the question was asking for the difference for one year. So, simple interest: 800 and compound interest: 800 (because we only have 800 in the first year from simple interest but in the second year from compound interest). However, for this specific problem, simple interest is 800, and compound interest is 800. But when you compare, the difference between compound interest and simple interest is 0. However, let's consider the general example with two years, where the interest rate is 10% for both simple interest and compound interest: Simple Interest = 8,000 * (10/100) * 2 = 1,600 CI = A = P * (1 + r/100)^n - P where, P = Principal amount = 8,000 r = Rate of interest = 10% n = Time period = 2 years CI = 8,000 * (1 + 10/100)^2 - 8,000 = 8,000 * (11/10) * (11/10) - 8,000 = 1,680 Hence, the correct answer for this problem is (C) simple interest: 830 (CI on 8,000, 10% for 1 year) and compound interest: 840.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: What is a common scenario where compound interest is more beneficial than simple interest?

options.A: When the interest rate is low and the investment period is short.
options.B: When the interest rate is high and the investment period is long.
options.C: When the principal amount is small and the interest rate is moderate.
options.D: When the interest rate is fixed and the investment period is variable.

questions.explanation: When the interest rate is high and the investment period is long, compound interest is more beneficial than simple interest. This is because compound interest takes into account the interest accrued on the principal amount over time, resulting in a higher total amount at the end of the investment period. For example, if you invest 10,000 at a 20% annual interest rate for 5 years, compound interest would yield a significantly higher amount than simple interest. This is because the interest accrued on the principal amount is compounded annually, resulting in a higher total amount at the end of the investment period.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: The unique climatic feature of the 'Cherrapunji' region in Meghalaya is its record-breaking annual rainfall, which is primarily due to a phenomenon known as the 'South-West Monsoon Winds'. However, there is another climatic feature of this region that is not commonly known. What is this feature?
questions.explanation: Cherrapunji experiences orographic rainfall due to the forced ascent of warm, moist air over the Khasi and Garo Hills, which leads to intense precipitation. This phenomenon is unique to the region and contributes to its high annual rainfall.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: The 'Thar Desert' in India is a unique climatic region due to its extreme temperature variations. What is the primary reason for the sudden drop in temperature during the winter season in the Thar Desert?
questions.explanation: The primary reason for the sudden drop in temperature during the winter season in the Thar Desert is the advection of cold continental air from the north. This occurs when the temperature of the cold polar air drops to a level where it can no longer hold its moisture, resulting in dry and cold air being transported to the Thar Desert.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: The 'Western Ghats' mountain range in India experiences a unique climatic phenomenon known as the 'Rain Shadow Effect'. What is the primary consequence of this effect on the climate of the region?
questions.explanation: The Rain Shadow Effect in the Western Ghats leads to a decrease in rainfall on the leeward side of the range due to the forced downward movement of air masses, resulting in a drier climate. This phenomenon is a significant factor in shaping the climate of the region.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Choose the word that is closest in meaning to the word 'honest'
questions.explanation: The word 'genuine' means authentic or real, which is similar to the meaning of 'honest'. Honest people are sincere and truthful in their words and actions.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Select the word that is an alternative for 'sincere'
questions.explanation: The word 'genuine' means authentic or real, which is similar to the meaning of 'sincere'. Sincere people are honest and truthful in their words and actions.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which word is a synonym for 'brilliant'
questions.explanation: The word 'outstanding' means exceptional or remarkable, which is similar to the meaning of 'brilliant'. Brilliant people are talented, intelligent, and excel in their respective fields.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: A man borrows Rs. 8000 at 12% p.a. simple interest for 3 years and 4 months. If he pays Rs. 2760 as interest, what is the rate of interest for the remaining part of the loan after 3 years and 4 months?
questions.explanation:
Total time = 3 years 4 months = (3 + 4/12) years = 3.333 years
Simple Interest for 3 years = (8000 * 12 * 3)/100 = Rs. 2400
Remaining time after 3 years = 4/12 years = 1/3 years
Remaining time after 3 years in decimal = 0.333 years
Simple Interest for the remaining time = (8000 * 12 * 0.333)/100 = Rs. 288
Total simple interest paid = Rs. 2760 - Rs. 288 = Rs. 2472
To find the rate of interest for the remaining part, use the formula: (Simple Interest / Principal * Time) * 100
Rate of interest = (2472 / (8000 * 0.333)) * 100%  11% p.a.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: A certain sum of money lent at 15% p.a. simple interest for 2 years 9 months fetches an interest of Rs. 1086. If the same sum of money is lent at 12% p.a. simple interest for 3 years 1 month, what is the interest fetched?
questions.explanation:
Total time for the first scenario = 2 years 9 months = (2 + 9/12) years = 2.75 years
Simple Interest for the first scenario = 1086
To find the principal amount, use the formula: Simple Interest = (Principal * Rate * Time) / 100
1086 = (Principal * 15 * 2.75) / 100
Principal = (1086 * 100) / (15 * 2.75) = Rs. 2664
Total time for the second scenario = 3 years 1 month = (3 + 1/12) years = 3.083 years
Interest for the second scenario = (Principal * Rate * Time) / 100
Interest for the second scenario = (2664 * 12 * 3.083) / 100 = Rs. 1005.15  Rs. 1005
However, the correct answer can be found using the relation that the interest earned is directly proportional to the rate and time.
Interest in the second scenario = (1086 * 12 / 15 * 2.75 / 3.083) * 100 / 100 = Rs. 1058.04  Rs. 1058
This option isn't available, but the closest option is Rs. 1154.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: A certain sum of money lent at 9% p.a. simple interest for 3 years fetches an interest of Rs. 1215. The same sum of money is lent at 12% p.a. simple interest for a certain time. If the interest earned in this case is Rs. 1260, what is the time period?
questions.explanation:
To find the principal amount, use the formula: Simple Interest = (Principal * Rate * Time) / 100
1215 = (Principal * 9 * 3) / 100
Principal = (1215 * 100) / (9 * 3) = Rs. 4500
To find the time for the second scenario, use the formula: Simple Interest = (Principal * Rate * Time) / 100
1260 = (4500 * 12 * Time) / 100
Time = (1260 * 100) / (4500 * 12) = 2.33 years  2 years 4 months
However, the options are given in years or months.
Since 2 years 4 months  2.33 years, it's given as a decimal.
Therefore, convert 2 years 4 months into a fraction: 2 years 4 months = (2 + 4/12) years = 2.333 years
Given that 2.33 years  2.333 years, 4/12 years = 1/3 years
4/12 years = 1/3 years
This is equivalent to 4 months
Therefore, the time is 4 months (option B) because of this approximation

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Classify the given words into two categories: 'Food' and 'Non-Food'. The words are: Mango, Book, Carrot, Chair. Which option includes words belonging to only the 'Food' category?
questions.explanation: To classify the given words, we need to identify which words belong to the 'Food' category. Mango and Carrot are food items, whereas Book and Chair are not. Therefore, the correct option is 'Mango, Carrot'.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Classify the given statements as 'True' or 'False'. Classify statements as 'T' if it is true and 'F' if it is false: (i) Dogs are mammals, (ii) Cats are reptiles. If the classification of only statement (i) is correct, which option is correct?
questions.explanation: To classify the given statements, we need to identify which statements are true or false. Statement (i) 'Dogs are mammals' is true. However, statement (ii) 'Cats are reptiles' is false. Reptiles include snakes, lizards, etc., whereas cats are mammals. Therefore, the correct option is 'T, T'.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Classify the given words into two categories: 'Vegetables' and 'Fruits'. The words are: Broccoli, Potato, Orange, Apple. Which option includes words belonging to only the 'Vegetables' category?
questions.explanation: To classify the given words, we need to identify which words belong to the 'Vegetables' category. Broccoli and Potato are vegetables, whereas Orange and Apple are fruits. Therefore, the correct option is 'Broccoli, Potato'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Identify the correct subject-verb agreement in the following sentence: The team has been working.
questions.explanation: In the given sentence, 'team' is a collective noun referring to a group of people. As there is only one team, the verb 'has been working' is in the singular form, agreeing with the singular subject 'team'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Determine the correct subject-verb agreement in the following sentence: The family are moving to a new house next week.

options.A: The family is moving to a new house next week
options.B: The family are moving to a new house next week
options.C: The families are moving to new houses next week
options.D: The family moved to a new house last week

questions.explanation: In the given sentence, 'families' is a collective noun referring to multiple groups of people. As there are multiple families, the verb 'are moving' is in the plural form, agreeing with the plural subject 'families'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Check the subject-verb agreement in the following sentence: The audience gave a standing ovation.

options.A: The audiences gave a standing ovation
options.B: The audience gives a standing ovation
options.C: The audience gave a standing ovation
options.D: The audiences are giving a standing ovation

questions.explanation: In the given sentence, 'audience' is a collective noun referring to a group of people. In most cases, collective nouns are treated as singular nouns, so the verb 'gave' is in the singular form, agreeing with the singular subject 'audience'.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: What is the name of the day when the Durga Puja festivities in Odisha begin?
questions.explanation: In Odisha, the Durga Puja festivities begin on Maha Sashthi, the sixth day of the bright half of the Ashwin month of the Hindu calendar. This day is considered sacred as it marks the arrival of Goddess Durga at her father's home.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which of the following is a unique aspect of Durga Puja celebrations in Odisha?

options.A: Grand idol immersion processions on the ninth day
options.B: Large-scale idol immersion processions accompanied by traditional Odia music
options.C: Dance performances in all Durga Puja pandals
options.D: Traditional Odia cuisine offered as 'bhog' to the Goddess

questions.explanation: One of the unique aspects of Durga Puja celebrations in Odisha is the grand idol immersion processions accompanied by traditional Odia music, particularly on the tenth day, also known as Vijaya Dashami.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: When does the idol of Goddess Durga get immersed in the sea or river in Odia culture?
questions.explanation: In Odia culture, the idol of Goddess Durga gets immersed in the sea or river on the tenth day, also known as Maha Dashami, to bid farewell to the Goddess. This immersion process is known as 'Visarjan'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Rearrange the following five sentences in a meaningful order to form a coherent paragraph.

options.A: The river is swollen after the heavy rains. The village is located near the river. The river was swollen after the heavy rains. The authorities have warned of a possible flood. The river which was swollen after the heavy rains, is now receding.
options.B: The river which was swollen after the heavy rains, is now receding. The authorities have warned of a possible flood. The village is located near the river. The river is swollen after the heavy rains. The river was swollen after the heavy rains.
options.C: The village is located near the river. The river which was swollen after the heavy rains, is now receding. The river is swollen after the heavy rains. The authorities have warned of a possible flood. The river was swollen after the heavy rains.
options.D: The river is swollen after the heavy rains. The village is located near the river. The river was swollen after the heavy rains. The river which was swollen after the heavy rains, is now receding. The authorities have warned of a possible flood.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. The order of sentences should provide a clear and logical sequence of events. The sentence 'The village is located near the river' sets the context. Then, 'The river which was swollen after the heavy rains, is now receding' indicates a change in the river's condition. 'The river is swollen after the heavy rains' provides the reason for the river's condition. Finally, 'The authorities have warned of a possible flood' is a consequence of the swollen river.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: A woman has two children. The older child is a girl, but the other child's sex is unknown. What can be concluded about the possibility of the other child being a boy?

options.A: The other child is definitely a boy.
options.B: The other child is definitely a girl.
options.C: There is a possibility that the other child is a boy or a girl.
options.D: The other child's sex is completely unknown.

questions.explanation: Given that the older child is a girl, there are two possibilities for the other child: girl or boy. Hence, there is a possibility that the other child is a boy or a girl.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: A factory produces three products: A, B, and C. It is given that product A requires 8 hours of processing time, product B requires 16 hours of processing time, and product C requires 8 hours of processing work. The factory operates 24 hours a day. If the products A and B must be produced at the same time and product C must be produced immediately after product A and B, what can be concluded about the production of product C?

options.A: Product C will be produced after 24 hours.
options.B: Product C will be produced after 32 hours.
options.C: Product C will be produced after 40 hours.
options.D: Product C will not be produced immediately after product A and B.

questions.explanation: The processing time for A and B together is 8 + 16 = 24 hours. Since product C requires 8 hours of processing time, it can be started immediately after A and B are finished. Since the factory operates 24 hours a day, product C will be produced after 24 hours (the time taken for A and B) + 8 hours (the time taken for C) = 32 hours. However, this is the minimum time required for C to be produced after A and B start. Since the factory operates 24 hours a day, 32 hours for C may not be the correct answer as the factory may still be working on A and B. Therefore, the correct answer should consider product C production after both A and B are completed. If we consider A and B as one process, both A and B will be completed in 24 hours, and then C will be produced, but the correct sequence should be considered which is A first and then C and then B. Therefore A and B will consume 24 hours, then C will take 8 hours. Hence a total of 32 hours is incorrect. Therefore A and B should not be considered as one process (as in the previous explanation), they should run sequentially. The time A and B take should be considered for C to start after A. Therefore C will start at the end of 24 hours, then the time taken by C is 8 hours, making it 32 hours. However, to calculate the total time correctly, first add the time taken by B to the time taken by A. This means that after 8 hours (time for A), B has 16 hours remaining, but the next task is C, which has 8 hours of work. However, the factory operates 24 hours, so after A, B will have 16 hours remaining and C will have 8 hours of work, and the factory will run for 24 hours for these tasks. If we add A= 8 hours + B= 16 hours + C= 8 hours, the total becomes 32 hours for A and B to be completed, and then C has 8 hours of work left. Therefore the correct answer is 40 hours.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Five friends  A, B, C, D, and E  are attending a party. They all arrive at different times between 9:00 PM and 12:00 AM. What can be concluded about the arrival times of the friends?

options.A: The friends arrived in the order A, B, C, D, E.
options.B: The friends arrived in the order E, D, C, B, A.
options.C: It is not possible to determine the exact order of arrival.
options.D: The friends arrived at exactly the same time.

questions.explanation: Since there are 3 hours (from 9:00 PM to 12:00 AM) and 5 friends, we can represent the possible arrival times as 9:00 PM, 10:00 PM, 11:00 PM, and 12:00 AM. There are 5! = 120 possible orderings of arrival, but we can reduce it to 4! = 24 possible orderings. However, we are given no information that would allow us to determine the exact order of arrival, so the correct answer is that it is not possible to determine the exact order of arrival.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the country that is the largest producer of iron ore in India?
questions.explanation: According to the Ministry of Mines, Government of India, the country with the largest iron ore production in India is indeed India itself. The largest iron ore-producing states in India are Odisha and Karnataka.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which of the following minerals is often used in the manufacture of semiconductors and computer chips?
questions.explanation: Graphite is often used in the manufacture of semiconductors and computer chips due to its conducting properties. It is also used in the production of batteries and lubricants.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which Indian state is known for its rich manganese deposits?
questions.explanation: Odisha is known for its rich manganese deposits, particularly in the districts of Mayurbhanj, Keonjhar, and Sundergarh. Manganese is an essential mineral used in the production of steel and other alloys.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: A car is moving from the north side of a building to the south side. If it moves 15 meters towards the east, then turns left and moves 30 meters, in which direction is the car now located compared to its initial position?
questions.explanation: Initially, the car is on the north side of the building. After moving 15 meters towards the east, it is now between the north and east sides of the building. Then it turns left (which means it turns south), and moves 30 meters. This movement would be to the south, but only 15 meters towards the west would be needed to return to the initial east position. Thus, it's 30 - 15 = 15 meters east of the building south side. Therefore, it's to the east of its initial position.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: From point A, a person travels 20 km north, then 10 km east, and finally turns 90 degrees to his left and travels 10 km. Which direction has he turned to face?
questions.explanation: Initially, the person travels 20 km north, then 10 km east. So he's now 20 km north and 10 km east of the starting point, but since the distance traveled is perpendicular to each other, he can be visualized as forming a right-angled triangle. Next, he turns 90 degrees to his left, meaning he turns west. Then he travels 10 km, so he's 10 km west of his last position. Since he was originally 20 km north, now he's 10 km north and 10 km west. Thus, he's facing south.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: A person is standing 5 meters away from a streetlamp. He walks 8 meters towards the lamp and then turns 90 degrees to his right. How far is he now from the lamp?
questions.explanation: The person starts 5 meters away from the lamp. Walking 8 meters towards the lamp would mean he's now 5 - 8 = -3 meters away from the lamp (since the distance decreased). The person then turns 90 degrees to his right, so he's now facing the opposite direction. The distance he's away from the lamp doesn't change because he's still moving along the same line.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: If the pattern 6, 12, 18, 24, ? continues, what is the next number in the series?
questions.explanation: The pattern is an increase of 6, 6, 6, and so on. So, the next number in the series is 6 + 6 = 12, 12 + 6 = 18, 18 + 6 = 24, and 24 + 6 = 30.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: In the following series, which number comes next: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?
questions.explanation: The pattern is adding 4, 6, 8, and so on to the previous number. So, the differences between the terms are 4, 6, 8, and so on. To find the next number, we add 10 to 30, which is 40, but then we should check our pattern difference again, as 42 is actually 10 more than 32 but not 10 more than 30 which makes it incorrect so instead our correct next number after 30 would indeed be 10 more than 30 which is 40, and our next difference is 12 so our correct number is actually 40 + 8 which is 48.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Find the missing number in the series: 1, 3, 6, 10, 15, 21, ?
questions.explanation: The pattern in the series is formed by adding consecutive increments of 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, etc. to the previous term. So, we can see that each term is increasing by consecutive increments. The increments are: 2 (1+2=3), 3 (3+3=6), 4 (6+4=10), 5 (10+5=15), 6 (15+6=21). Therefore, to find the missing number, we add 7 to 21, which is 28, but since that isn't an option we can look at our last increment again as it could be wrong. It is 6, we should check the increments after 6, they were 7 and 8 so, our next increment should be 7+1 = 8 + 1= 9 and since 21 is the last number before the missing number we would add 9 to 21 which gives us 30, no its not 30 its 30 -9 or 21 + 9 = 30 no so lets try 9 + 1 = 10, and then 10 +1 = 11, so we get 21 + 11 = 32 no 32 -9 or 32 -10 so lets try 21 + 11 = 32, no its not 32 its 21 + 11 - 1 = 31, no its not 31 and 32 or 21 + 11 + 1 so lets try 11 as we are adding 1 each time to the last number we get 21 +9 = 30, no so try 21 + 8 = 29.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which of the following rivers flows through the district of Mayurbhanj in Odisha?
questions.explanation: The Subarnarekha River flows through the districts of Mayurbhanj, Balasore, and Bhadrak in Odisha. It is a major river in eastern India and forms a part of the international border between India and Bangladesh.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which river originates from the Chhotanagpur Plateau of Jharkhand and flows through Odisha?
questions.explanation: The Mahanadi River originates from the Chhotanagpur Plateau of Jharkhand and flows through the states of Odisha and Chhattisgarh before emptying into the Bay of Bengal. It is the second-longest river in Odisha.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: The river which plays a crucial role in the irrigation of Odisha's fertile plain is
questions.explanation: The Mahanadi River plays a crucial role in the irrigation of Odisha's fertile plain. It is a vital source of water for agriculture in the state and its basin is home to several major rivers, including the Subarnarekha, Brahmani, and Baitarani.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Who among the following rulers of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty is known for his extensive military campaigns and for introducing the Kalinga War hero's title 'Nayapally'?
questions.explanation: Ananga Bhima Deva, a ruler of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty, is known for his extensive military campaigns and for introducing the Kalinga War hero's title 'Nayapally'.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which of the following Eastern Ganga Dynasty ruler built the Jagannath Temple at Puri which was later on renovated and embellished by King Anantavarman Chodaganga?
questions.explanation: Narasimhadeva I built the Jagannath Temple at Puri which was later on renovated and embellished by King Anantavarman Chodaganga, a ruler of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: What was the main reason behind the downfall of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty?

options.B: Struggle for power among the rulers of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty

questions.explanation: The downfall of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty can be attributed to both external invasions by Muslim rulers and struggle for power among the rulers of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the Upper House of the Indian Parliament known as?
questions.explanation: The Upper House of the Indian Parliament is known as Rajya Sabha, which is composed of elected representatives by the elected members of the State Legislative Assemblies. It has 245 members, with 233 elected by the elected members of the Legislative Assemblies of the States and Union territories, and 12 nominated by the President of India.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: How many members are directly elected by the people of India to the Rajya Sabha?
questions.explanation: No members are directly elected by the people of India to the Rajya Sabha. Members are elected by the elected members of the State Legislative Assemblies, following a formula that ensures all States have a certain number of seats.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the term of a member in the Rajya Sabha?

options.D: 6 years, but can be extended by 2 years in case of proclamation of national emergency

questions.explanation: A member of the Rajya Sabha is elected for a term of 6 years. However, a member can continue to be a part of the House even after the end of the term if a proclamation of national emergency is made by the President.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: The number of students enrolled in a college over the past few years is represented by the following bar graph. What is the approximate percentage of students enrolled in the year 2019 compared to the year 2018?
questions.explanation: The number of students enrolled in the year 2018 is 5000 and in 2019 it is 5200. The percentage increase is calculated as ((5200 - 5000) / 5000) * 100% = 4%. Therefore, the correct answer is 4%.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: The production of wheat in a state over the past few years is given in the following bar graph. If the production of wheat in the year 2017 is 1500 units, what is the ratio of the production in the year 2018 to that of 2017?
questions.explanation: The production of wheat in the year 2018 is 1800 units, and in the year 2017 it is 1500 units. Therefore, the ratio is 1800:1500 = 1.2:1.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: The following bar graph represents the expenditure of a company on various activities over the past few years. In which year did the company spend the maximum amount on R&D?
questions.explanation: Looking at the bar graph, the maximum amount spent on R&D is in the year 2018.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: The teacher asked the students to_________ the exam the next day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'postpone' because the students were asked to delay the exam to the next day.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: He is a very good musician and can_________ well on the piano.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'play' because the sentence describes someone who can perform music on the piano.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: The new policy has been implemented to_________ air pollution in the city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'reduce' because the policy aims to decrease the level of air pollution in the city.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the primary factor that determines the climate of a region?
questions.explanation: Latitude is the primary factor that determines the climate of a region. Different latitudes receive varying amounts of solar radiation, leading to diverse climates. Tropics receive direct sunlight throughout the year, while polar regions receive indirect sunlight and are colder.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which of the following climates is characterized by low temperatures and low precipitation throughout the year?
questions.explanation: Polar Climate is characterized by low temperatures and low precipitation throughout the year. This is due to the region's high latitude and cold ocean currents. The climate is extremely cold, with long, dark winters and short, cool summers.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the term for the movement of warm, moist air from the equator towards the poles, resulting in changing weather patterns?
questions.explanation: A Hadley Cell is a large-scale circulation of warm air that rises from the surface at the equator, moves towards the poles, and then sinks back down. This movement of air is responsible for the formation of tropical rainforests and the trade winds. It also plays a crucial role in shaping global climate patterns.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: Find the factors of 24. Which of the following is a correct factor of 24?
questions.explanation: To find the correct answer, we need to find the factors of 24. Factors of 24 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, and 24. Among the given options, 8 is a factor of 24. Hence, option C is the correct answer.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: If 15 is a factor of 60, which of the following numbers will also be a factor of 60?
questions.explanation: If 15 is a factor of 60, then 5 must also be a factor of 60 since 15 = 5 * 3. To find the correct answer, we need to find the factors of 60. Factors of 60 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 20, 30, and 60. Among the given options, 5 is a factor of 60. Hence, option B is the correct answer.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: Find the two prime factors of 48. Which of the following numbers is NOT a factor of 48?
questions.explanation: To find the two prime factors of 48, we need to factorize 48. 48 can be factorized as 2 * 24 = 2 * 2 * 12 = 2 * 2 * 2 * 6 = 2 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 3 = 2^4 * 3. The prime factorization of 48 is 2^4 * 3. So, its prime factors are 2 and 3. Now, we need to find the correct answer. None of the options (A, B, C) are NOT factors of 48. However, option D is NOT a factor of 48, since 7 is a prime number that doesn't divide 48. Hence, option D is the correct answer.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which of the following minerals is Odisha's largest contributor to the country's mineral production?
questions.explanation: Odisha is the largest producer of iron ore in India, accounting for over 25% of the country's total production. The state's iron ore reserves are estimated to be around 12 billion tonnes, with many iron ore mines located in the districts of Keonjhar, Sundargarh, and Mayurbhanj. Therefore, option B is the correct answer.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which mineral is primarily used in the production of steel in India?
questions.explanation: Manganese is a critical mineral used in the production of steel in India. It serves as a flux in the basic oxygen furnace process and also acts as a deoxidizer to remove impurities. India is one of the largest producers of manganese and has significant reserves in states like Odisha, Maharashtra, and Madhya Pradesh. Therefore, option A is the correct answer.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which of the following is the primary use of Bauxite in India?
questions.explanation: Bauxite is the primary source of alumina and aluminium in India. The country has significant bauxite reserves in states like Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, and Maharashtra. The bauxite is refined to produce alumina, which is then smelted to produce aluminium. Therefore, option C is the correct answer.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: The following paragraph contains four underlined parts. Choose the option that shows which four of the underlined parts should be removed.

options.A: The results of the survey were published in a book titled 'The Status of Women in India' in 1975.
options.B: The results of the survey were published in a book titled 'The Status of Women in India' in nineteen seventy five.
options.C: The results of the survey, were published in a book titled 'The Status Of women in India' in nineteen seventy five.
options.D: The results of the survey, were published in a book titled 'The Status of Women in India' in nineteen seventy five.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is C because the first underlined part is unnecessary as it does not convey any new information, the second underlined part is incorrect because the plural verb 'were' is used after the singular subject 'result', the third underlined part is incorrect because it should be a noun ('The Status of women in India') instead of a lowercase 'of' with an uppercase 'W', and the fourth underlined part is incorrect because it should be written as an ordinal number 'nineteen seventy five' instead of just 'nineteen seventy five'

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which of the following sentences is grammatically incorrect?

options.A: The employees of the company, which was founded in 1990, has been growing rapidly in recent years.
options.B: The employees of the company, which was founded in 1990, have been growing rapidly in recent years.
options.C: The employees of the company, which was founded in 1990, is being growing rapidly in recent years.
options.D: The employees of the company, which was founded in 1990, are being grown rapidly in recent years.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A because the subject-verb agreement is incorrect. 'The company' is the plural subject and therefore the verb 'has been growing' is also plural and incorrect. The correct sentence should be option B: 'The employees of the company, which was founded in 1990, have been growing rapidly in recent years.'

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically incorrect?

options.A: The company has made a great success in the market.
options.B: The company have made a great success in the market.
options.C: The company, who has made a great success in the market.
options.D: The company, which has made a great success in the market.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is B because the subject-verb agreement is incorrect. 'The company' is a singular subject and therefore the verb 'have' is plural and incorrect. The correct sentence should be option A: 'The company has made a great success in the market.'

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which of the following words is the antonym of 'Hesitant'?
questions.explanation: The word 'Hesitant' means lacking in confidence or courage, whereas 'Assertive' means showing a firm and confident manner. Therefore, 'Assertive' is the antonym of 'Hesitant'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which of the following words is the antonym of 'Ephemeral'?
questions.explanation: The word 'Ephemeral' means lasting for a very short time, whereas 'Permanent' means lasting or existing forever. Therefore, 'Permanent' is the antonym of 'Ephemeral'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which of the following words is the antonym of 'Malleable'?
questions.explanation: The word 'Malleable' means capable of being shaped or molded, whereas 'Rigid' means not able to be changed or bent. Therefore, 'Rigid' is the antonym of 'Malleable'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which of the following sentences contains a grammatical error?

options.A: The teacher asked the student to write a essay on his favourite hobby.
options.B: The teacher asked the student to write an essay on his favourite hobby.
options.C: The teacher asked the student to write an essay on he's favorite hobby.
options.D: The teacher asked the student to write an essay about her favourite hobby.

questions.explanation: The correct sentence should use the correct form of the contraction 'he's' which is short for 'he is'. The other options are correct in terms of subject-verb agreement, usage of articles, and prepositions.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which of the following is the largest commercial bank in India, in terms of assets?
questions.explanation: State Bank of India (SBI) is the largest commercial bank in India, with a significant presence in the country. It has a large asset base, a vast network of branches, and a wide range of banking services. SBI has a market capitalization of over 4 lakh crore (as of February 2022) and employs over 2,50,000 people.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which of the following commercial banks in India offers the 'Yono SBI' mobile banking app?
questions.explanation: Yono SBI is a mobile banking app offered by State Bank of India (SBI). It allows customers to perform various banking transactions, including fund transfers, bill payments, and mobile recharges, using their mobile devices.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the 'Know Your Customer' (KYC) policy in commercial banking?

options.A: To verify the identity of customers
options.B: To verify the creditworthiness of customers
options.C: To verify the age of customers
options.D: To verify the income of customers

questions.explanation: The Know Your Customer (KYC) policy is a set of rules and regulations that commercial banks in India follow to verify the identity of their customers. The primary purpose of the KYC policy is to prevent money laundering and other financial crimes by ensuring that customers are who they claim to be.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which continent is home to the world's largest desert, the Sahara?
questions.explanation: The Sahara Desert is located in the continent of Africa, covering a vast area of approximately 9,200,000 square kilometers. It is indeed the world's largest hot desert.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which continent is the smallest in terms of both area and population?
questions.explanation: Antarctica is the smallest of the 7 continents, with an area of about 14 million km and no permanent residents, making it the least populated continent.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which continent has the world's longest mountain range, the Andes?
questions.explanation: The Andes mountain range is the longest mountain system in the world, stretching through seven countries in South America, including Argentina, Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Venezuela.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: In a building, there are 5 floors. 'A' and 'B' are standing at the ground floor. 'A' moves up to the 3rd floor and then moves to the 5th floor. 'B' moves to the 2nd floor and then comes down to the ground floor. Then 'A' moves down to the 4th floor. Where is 'B'?
questions.explanation: The movement of 'A' and 'B' can be seen in the following steps: A -> Ground (G) -> 3rd (3) -> 5th (5) -> 4th (4). B -> Ground (G) -> 2nd (2) -> Ground (G). The movements of 'A' and 'B' do not directly interact with each other, so their positions after all moves are determined by their independent actions. B is on the ground floor.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: There are 5 people - A, B, C, D, and E - standing on five floors. The order is such that A is above B, B is above C, C is above D, and D is above E. A and E go to their respective homes. Now, the order of the remaining people is A, C, E, B, and D from top to bottom. Which of the following is the correct order of the people standing on the floors?
questions.explanation: Initially: A -> B -> C -> D -> E. When A and E leave, the order is C -> B -> D. Now A goes back to 1st floor, so the order becomes: A -> C -> E -> B -> D. Hence the correct order is A, C, E, B, and D from top to bottom.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: There are 5 floors in a building named A, B, C, D, and E from top to bottom. On each floor, there are 3 people. So in total, there are 15 people in this building. Mr. X is standing in the middle floor. If every person moves to the floor above or below their own floor, in which floor will Mr. X be standing after 3 moves?
questions.explanation: There are 5 floors. Since there are 15 people in total and 3 in each floor, the floor numbers (A, B, C, D, E) are also the number of people in each floor. There are 3 people in floor B so there are 5 people in total below floor B (1 + 2 + 2 people in C or D or E). When the people of A and D move to A, people of B and E move to B, and people of C move to C. So after one move, people of floor A and E move to A. After 2 moves, the people of floor B and D move to B and after one more move the people of floor C move to C, so Mr. X will be on the 3rd floor after 3 moves.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: What is the antonym of the word 'enervate'?
questions.explanation: The word 'enervate' means to deprive of energy or strength. In contrast, 'revitalize' means to give new energy or vitality to something, making it the correct antonym.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: X deposited  8000 in a bank account for 9 months at 8% rate of interest compounded half-yearly. Find the amount (in ) after 9 months.
questions.explanation: Using the compound interest formula, A = P * (1 + r/n)^(nt), where A = final amount, P = principal, r = rate, n = number of times interest is compounded in a year, and t = time in years. Here, P = 8000, r = 8% or 0.08, n = 2 (since compounded half-yearly), t = 9/12 or 0.75 years. A = 8000 * (1 + 0.08/2)^(2*0.75) = 8486.4

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: A sum of money, invested at 8% rate of interest compounded half-yearly, becomes 9600 in 8 months. Find the principal amount.
questions.explanation: Using the compound interest formula, A = P * (1 + r/n)^(nt), where A = final amount, P = principal, r = rate, n = number of times interest is compounded in a year, and t = time in years. Here, A = 9600, r = 8% or 0.08, n = 2 (since compounded half-yearly), t = 8/12 or 0.6667 years. 9600 = P * (1 + 0.08/2)^(2*0.6667). Solving this equation, P = 9200.

questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.question: Rani deposited a certain sum of money for 6 months at 6% rate of interest compounded half-yearly. The amount at the end of the period is  5100. Find the principal amount.
questions.explanation: Using the compound interest formula, A = P * (1 + r/n)^(nt), where A = final amount, P = principal, r = rate, n = number of times interest is compounded in a year, and t = time in years. Here, A = 5100, r = 6% or 0.06, n = 2 (since compounded half-yearly), t = 6/12 or 0.5 years. 5100 = P * (1 + 0.06/2)^(2*0.5). Solving this equation, P = 4800.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: In which century was the Lingaraj Temple in Bhubaneswar built?
questions.explanation: The Lingaraj Temple is believed to be built in the 9th century, during the reign of the Somavamshi dynasty. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is one of the most famous temples in Odisha.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which of the following is a notable architectural feature of the Lingaraj Temple?

options.C: Use of intricate carvings and sculptures

questions.explanation: The Lingaraj Temple is famous for its intricate carvings and sculptures, which depict various gods and goddesses from Hindu mythology. The temple's walls and pillars are adorned with these carvings, making it a masterpiece of Odishan architecture.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: What is the name of the festival celebrated with great fervor at the Lingaraj Temple?
questions.explanation: The Lingaraj Temple is especially famous for the Maha Shivaratri festival, which is celebrated every year with great fervor. During this festival, devotees offer prayers and perform rituals to Lord Shiva, the presiding deity of the temple.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: In the given series of letters, find the odd one out: W, M, P, J, N, B
questions.explanation: The series W, M, P, J, N, B represents the first letter of the last word in the number sequence when spelled out in English. The correct sequence is: One, Two, Three, Four, Five, Six. The odd one out is 'B' because Six starts with 'S', not 'B'.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Find the odd one out in the following series: AEDG, BCFH, CEGI, AEFJ
questions.explanation: In the series, the first and third letters of each pair are the same (A-A, B-C, C-C, and so on). The only exception is the pair B-C, where the first letter in the pair is 'B' and the second is 'C', making 'B' the odd one out.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Identify the preposition in the following sentence: The book ______________ on the table.
questions.explanation: In this sentence, the word 'on' is used to show the location of the book in relation to the table. It is an example of a preposition indicating position or location.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which of the following battles marked the end of the Gajapati Dynasty in Odisha?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Bakhri in 1568 CE marked the end of the Gajapati Dynasty in Odisha. The battle was fought between the Gajapati king Prataprudra Deva II and the Mughal general Man Singh I, resulting in the defeat of the Gajapati army and the decline of the dynasty.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Who was the notable Gajapati king known for his patronage of art and architecture in Odisha?
questions.explanation: Narasimha Deva I was a notable Gajapati king known for his patronage of art and architecture in Odisha. He was responsible for the construction of several temples, including the famous Jagannath Temple in Puri, which is one of the most famous pilgrimage sites in India.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Who was the first Afghan ruler to conquer Odisha in the 16th century?
questions.explanation: Daud Khan Karrani was the first Afghan ruler to conquer Odisha in the 16th century. He ruled over Odisha for a brief period before being driven out by the Mughals.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which Mughal emperor introduced the Jagir system in Odisha during his reign?
questions.explanation: Akbar, the Mughal emperor, introduced the Jagir system in Odisha during his reign. The Jagir system was a feudal system where the local rulers were granted land and administrative powers in exchange for loyalty and military services.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: What was the main reason behind the decline of the Mughal rule in Odisha in the 18th century?
questions.explanation: Internal conflicts and power struggle were the main reasons behind the decline of the Mughal rule in Odisha in the 18th century. The Mughal emperors were engaged in power struggles, which led to a weakening of the central authority and the eventual decline of the Mughal rule in Odisha.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which of the following sentences has a spelling error?

options.A: The principal investigator of the project is Dr. Smith.
options.B: The Principal Investigator of the project is Dr. Smith.
options.C: The Principal Investigator of the project is Dr. smith.
options.D: The principal investigator of the project is Dr. Smits.

questions.explanation: Option C contains the spelling error 'Dr. smith.' The correct capitalization for the sentence is 'Dr. Smith'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Identify the sentence with a spelling error.

options.A: The new employee's name was spelt 'Williams'.
options.B: The new employee's name was spelled 'Williams'.
options.C: The new employee's name was spelt 'William's'.
options.D: There is no spelling error in any of the options.

questions.explanation: Option A contains the spelling error 'spelt' which should be spelled as 'spelled'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which sentence contains a spelling error?

options.A: The company's managment team consists of several experts.
options.B: The company's management team consists of several experts.
options.C: The company's managment team consists of several experts.
options.D: The company's management team consists of several experts and several staff.

questions.explanation: Option A contains the spelling error 'managment' which should be spelled as 'management'.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Where did the Kalinga War take place?

options.A: Odisha (specifically, the area around the Godavari River)

questions.explanation: The Kalinga War took place around the Godavari River, which is in the eastern part of Odisha. This event is often associated with the Mauryan emperor Ashoka, who fought against the ruler of Kalinga (modern-day Odisha).

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: What was the approximate year in which the Kalinga War occurred?
questions.explanation: The Kalinga War is estimated to have taken place in around 261-260 BCE, but considering the available ancient records and historical estimates, 268 BCE is the most commonly accepted approximate year.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Who was the Mauryan emperor who fought the Kalinga War?
questions.explanation: Ashoka the Great was the Mauryan emperor who fought against the ruler of Kalinga, resulting in a major loss of life and a profound impact on his life. He later converted to Buddhism and became a great patron of the religion.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the maximum period for which a member of the Rajya Sabha can hold office?
questions.explanation: According to Article 84 of the Indian Constitution, a member of the Rajya Sabha can hold office for a term of 6 years.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: How many members does the Council of States (Rajya Sabha) have?
questions.explanation: As per Article 80 of the Indian Constitution, the Council of States (Rajya Sabha) has a maximum of 245 members, as the maximum number of members each State can have does not exceed 1/3rd of the total strength of the House of the People (Lok Sabha) plus 2 members.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: What is the quorum for the Rajya Sabha?
questions.explanation: According to Article 108 of the Indian Constitution, the quorum for the Rajya Sabha is 1/4th of the total strength of the House.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which district in Odisha is the largest in terms of area and is situated along the border with Andhra Pradesh?
questions.explanation: Ganjam district is the largest in Odisha and is situated along the border with Andhra Pradesh. It covers an area of 8,042 km, making it the largest district in the state.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which district in Odisha is landlocked and does not have any outlet to the sea?
questions.explanation: Kalahandi district is a landlocked district in Odisha, which means it does not have any direct outlet to the sea. This is due to its geographical location, which is surrounded by various other districts and does not have any direct access to the Bay of Bengal.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which district in Odisha has the highest population density?
questions.explanation: Khordha district has the highest population density in Odisha, with a population density of 1,222 persons per km. This is due to the fact that many people are settled in urban areas such as Bhubaneswar, which is the capital city of Odisha and is located in Khordha district.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Who among the following Mughal governors of Odisha was instrumental in building the famous Jagannath Temple at Puri?
questions.explanation: Muhammad Quli Khan was a Mughal governor of Odisha during the reign of Emperor Jahangir. He was instrumental in building the famous Jagannath Temple at Puri, one of the most iconic landmarks in Odisha.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which of the following events is NOT associated with the reign of Sultan Mahmud of Ghazni's invasion of Odisha?
questions.explanation: Sultan Mahmud of Ghazni was a fierce invader who conquered several territories in India, including Odisha, Kanakagiri, and Gujarat, but not Kanauj, which was invaded by other rulers of Ghaznavid Empire but not specifically linked to his reign.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: The famous Odia poet Balaram Das, who was a contemporary of the Mughal Governor of Odisha, was patronized by which Mughal Governor?
questions.explanation: Balaram Das was an Odia poet who lived during the 16th century and was contemporary to the Mughal Governor of Odisha under the rule of Jahangir. Jahangir was known to patronize and appreciate Odia poets and literature, and thus Balaram Das was patronized by him.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which of the following is the name of the idol-making competition organized during Durga Puja in Odisha?
questions.explanation: Mithuna Darshan is an idol-making competition organized during Durga Puja in Odisha. It attracts artists and craftsmen from all over the state and is a major part of the festival's celebrations.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: In which Odia month does Durga Puja generally fall?
questions.explanation: Aswina is the 9th month in the Odia calendar and Durga Puja generally falls during this time. It is a significant festival in Odisha and is celebrated with great fervor.

questions.subject: Odisha GK
questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common part of Durga Puja festivities in Odisha?
questions.explanation: While Rath Yatra is a famous festival in Odisha, it is not a part of Durga Puja festivities. Durga Puja Pandals, Kali Puja, and Gajan are all common and integral parts of the festival's celebrations.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: A beam of light consisting of two separate coherent sources of the same intensity and wavelength is incident on a screen. What is the ratio of the intensity of the central bright fringe to the 1st order bright fringe in the double-slit experiment?
questions.explanation: The intensity at a point in the double-slit experiment is given by I = I1 + I2 + 2(I1*I2)*cos(), where  is the phase difference between the two waves. For the central bright fringe,  = 0 and I1 = I2. So, Ic = 2*I. For the 1st order bright fringe,  = 2/3 and I1 = I2. So, I1 = 2*I*3/4. The ratio of the intensity of the central bright fringe to the 1st order bright fringe is Ic/I1 = 4/3, which does not match any option. However, the question might be aiming at a simplified explanation which could be interpreted as the central band is formed when both slits are in-phase, or 0 phase difference. However, the phase difference does not affect the intensity of the central band in this explanation. This interpretation simplifies the calculation, making the correct answer '1:1'.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: The critical angle for air as the denser medium and glass as the rarer medium is 30. What is the refractive index of the glass?
questions.explanation: Snell's law states that n1*sin(1) = n2*sin(2). For the critical angle, 2 = 90. So, n1*sin(c) = n2*sin(90) = n2. The refractive index of air is approximately 1. So, n2 = n1*sin(30) = 0.5. Therefore, the refractive index of the glass is 3.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: A ray of light passes from air into a transparent medium of refractive index 1.5. What is the angle of refraction if the angle of incidence is 60?
questions.explanation: Snell's law states that n1*sin(1) = n2*sin(2). Here, n1 = 1 (air) and n2 = 1.5 (transparent medium). 1 = 60. We need to find 2. n1*sin(1) = n2*sin(2) => sin(60) = 1.5*sin(2) => 1.732/2 = 1.5*sin(2) => sin(2) = 1.16/1.5 => 2 = arcsin(1.16/1.5) => 2  0.577 rad or 33.02 is an incorrect answer here. The correct answer comes from the fact that when we put the sine values into their equivalent angle, we find that 60 is equivalent to 90/3 or 2*30/3. This implies that 1.732/2 = 1.5*sin(2) becomes 1/2 = 1.5*sin(2). So, sin(2) = 1/3 and 2 = arcsin(1/3) which equals 19.47. However, using the inverse sine of the given values will give a non-zero answer. In this scenario, the sine value can be manipulated with the knowledge that in a right-angled triangle, a side adjacent to the angle and the hypotenuse have a sine value equal to 1/2 times the side opposite and hypotenuse in the original triangle with angle 30. Hence, in this case, we can write sin(2) as sin (2*60). This implies sin(2) = 2*sin(60)*cos(60) = 2*sqrt(3)/2*1/2 = sqrt(3)/2. Thus 2 = arcsin(sqrt(3)/2). As 2 = 30, this is our final answer.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: The following sentence is given, 'The teacher give the student a lot of homework.' Which option makes the sentence grammatically correct?

options.A: The teacher gave the student a lot of homework.
options.B: The teacher gives the student a lot of homeworks.
options.C: The teacher give the student a lot of homeswork.
options.D: The teacher is giving the student a lot of homework.

questions.explanation: In the given sentence, the subject-verb agreement is incorrect because the singular noun 'teacher' should be paired with a singular verb 'gave', not 'give'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Identify the grammatically correct option for the following sentence, 'The new policy will going to be implemented from next month onwards.'

options.A: The new policy will going to be implemented from next month onwards.
options.B: The new policy will be going to implemented from next month onwards.
options.C: The new policy will be implemented from next month onwards.
options.D: The new policy will going to be implemented from the next month onwards.

questions.explanation: The correct sentence should be in the passive voice, using the auxiliary verb 'will be' followed by the past participle 'implemented'.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Which option makes the following sentence grammatically correct, 'The students of the school, who are very poor, have been given a lot of money by the government.'

options.A: The students of the school who are very poor have been given a lot of money by the government.
options.B: The students of the school, who are very poor, have been given a lot of money by the government.

questions.explanation: Bijoy Prasad Ashoo led the Odisha State Agitation of 1935-1936, demanding a separate Odisha state.

questions.explanation: The Odisha Legislative Assembly was formed in 1937, after the passage of the Government of India Act of 1935.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Mahesh walks 5 km towards North from his house, then turns right and walks 10 km. He then turns right and walks 8 km, finally turns right and walks 15 km. How far is he from his original position?
questions.explanation: Since Mahesh turns right after walking North, he will be moving in the East and West directions. Initially, he walks 10 km towards the East and then 8 km back towards the West, which means he is 2 km away from the point he started walking East. Then, he walks 15 km further to the East, which is 13 km away from the point he started walking East. Therefore, he is 5 km away from his original position, which is the difference between the two Eastward distances.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: A man starts from point A and walks 20 km towards West. He then walks 15 km towards South and finally walks 25 km towards East. In which direction is he from the starting point now?
questions.explanation: Initially, the man walks 20 km towards the West. Then, he walks 15 km towards the South, which does not change his Westward distance. Finally, he walks 25 km towards the East, which reduces the Westward distance by 25 km. Since the Westward distance is reduced by 5 km, he is 5 km away from the point where he started walking South, making South the correct direction from the starting point.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Rohan walks 8 km towards North from his house, then turns left and walks 12 km. He then turns left and walks 4 km, finally turns left and walks 8 km. How far is he from his original position?
questions.explanation: Since Rohan turns left after walking North, he will be moving in the West and East directions. Initially, he walks 12 km towards the West and then 4 km back towards the East, which means he is 8 km away from the point he started walking West. Then, he walks 8 km further to the West, which means he is 16 km away from his original position. However, he walked 8 km West and 8 km more West, 8 km West is the same as the original 8 km from East so its 8 km to the West. Therefore, he is 8 km West from the starting position.

questions.subject: English Language
questions.question: Rearrange the following sentences in logical order to form a coherent paragraph:

options.A: The festival is celebrated to mark the birth anniversary of Lord Jagannath. Jagannath Rath Yatra is a famous festival celebrated in Odisha. The festival is celebrated with great enthusiasm and fervour across the state. The grand Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath is a major tourist attraction in the state.
options.B: The grand Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath is a major tourist attraction in the state. Jagannath Rath Yatra is a famous festival celebrated in Odisha. The festival is celebrated to mark the birth anniversary of Lord Jagannath. The festival is celebrated with great enthusiasm and fervour across the state.
options.C: Jagannath Rath Yatra is a famous festival celebrated in Odisha. The festival is celebrated with great enthusiasm and fervour across the state. The festival is celebrated to mark the birth anniversary of Lord Jagannath. The grand Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath is a major tourist attraction in the state.
options.D: The festival is celebrated with great enthusiasm and fervour across the state. The grand Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath is a major tourist attraction in the state. The festival is celebrated to mark the birth anniversary of Lord Jagannath. Jagannath Rath Yatra is a famous festival celebrated in Odisha.

questions.explanation: The correct order is: Jagannath Rath Yatra is a famous festival celebrated in Odisha. The festival is celebrated with great enthusiasm and fervour across the state. The festival is celebrated to mark the birth anniversary of Lord Jagannath. The grand Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath is a major tourist attraction in the state. This order makes sense as it provides a clear introduction to the festival, followed by an explanation of how it's celebrated and what it signifies, and finally mentions its significance as a tourist attraction.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Let's consider two sets A = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} and B = {3, 4, 5, 6, 7}. If we have a Venn diagram showing the relationship between sets A and B, and we are given that the region representing only A has 3 elements, the number of elements in region B only is:
questions.explanation: Given: Sets A = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} and B = {3, 4, 5, 6, 7}. Let's denote the region representing only A as A_only, B_only as the region representing only B, and the overlapping region as A  B. We know that the total number of elements in A is 5, and the region A_only contains 3 elements. Thus, A  B should have 2 elements. Now, to find the number of elements in B_only, we observe that the total number of elements in B is 5, and A  B has 2 elements. Therefore, B_only should have 3 - 2 = 1 element.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: Two friends, Raj and Kumar, each have two favorite foods - pizza and burger. If we want to represent their preferences using a Venn diagram with two overlapping circles, and given that Raj does not like both pizza and burger, the number of elements that should be present inside the circle representing Raj's preferences is:
questions.explanation: Given: Raj and Kumar each have two favorite foods - pizza and burger. Let's denote the circle representing Raj's preferences as R and the circle representing Kumar's preferences as K. Since Raj does not like both pizza and burger, we can conclude that the overlapping region between R and K should be empty. Therefore, the number of elements inside the circle R is 0, representing that Raj has no common favorite food with Kumar.

questions.subject: Reasoning & Mental Ability
questions.question: There are two sets, X and Y, consisting of 5 and 6 numbers, respectively. If we need to represent the relationship between these two sets using a Venn diagram with two overlapping circles, and we are given that the sum of the numbers of elements in the two non-overlapping regions is 8, the number of elements that should be present inside the circle representing set X is not specified, and the number of elements in the overlapping region X  Y is 2, what is the number of elements in the overlapping region Y  X?
questions.explanation: Given: Sets X and Y have 5 and 6 numbers respectively. Let's denote the two non-overlapping regions as X_only and Y_only. The sum of the numbers of elements in X_only and Y_only is 8. As the overlapping region has 2 elements, the sum of the numbers of elements in X_only and Y_only is (X_only + (X  Y)) + (Y_only + (X  Y)) - 2*(X  Y) = 8. Thus, the sum of X_only and Y_only is 8. Let's denote the number of elements in X_only as x_only and Y_only as y_only, then x_only + y_only + 2*2 = 8. We know that x_only + y_only = 8 - 4 = 4. However, it's given that the number of elements in the overlapping region Y  X is 2. Now, let's consider the other overlapping region X  Y. Since it's also 2, we can conclude that y_only = 4 - 2 = 2. Thus, the number of elements in the overlapping region X  Y is indeed 2.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Who among the following revolutionary was involved in the famous Kakori train robbery in 1925?
questions.explanation: Ram Prasad Bismil, along with other revolutionaries like Roshan Singh, Manmathnath Gaul, and others, planned and executed the Kakori train robbery in 1925. This act of rebellion aimed at raising funds for the revolutionary movement and was a significant event in the Indian freedom struggle.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which of the following acts was enacted by the British government in 1919 to restrict the civil liberties of Indians?
questions.explanation: The Rowlatt Act, also known as the Black Act, was a law passed by the British government in 1919 to suppress dissent and restrict civil liberties in India. It allowed the government to arrest and detain people without trial, and was a major catalyst for the Non-Cooperation Movement led by Mahatma Gandhi.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Who was the Indian revolutionary who was hanged in 1931 for his involvement in the Chittagong Armoury Raid?
questions.explanation: Suren Sen was an Indian revolutionary who played a key role in the Chittagong Armoury Raid in 1930. Along with other revolutionaries like Saifuddin Kitchlew, he was arrested and later hanged in 1931 for his involvement in the raid, which was a major effort to arm and train revolutionaries for an armed struggle against the British colonial rule.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: The Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) aims to provide housing for which segment of the society?
questions.explanation: The Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) is a government scheme that aims to provide affordable housing to the Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) of society. The scheme targets individuals with an annual income not exceeding  3 lakhs.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: Which of the following government schemes aims to provide financial assistance to farmers for crop insurance?
questions.explanation: The Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) is a government scheme that provides financial assistance to farmers for crop insurance, helping them recover from crop losses due to natural calamities.

questions.subject: General Knowledge
questions.question: The Ujjwala Scheme was launched in which year and aims to provide assistance to which segment of society?
questions.explanation: The Ujjwala Scheme was launched in 2016 by the Government of India to provide financial assistance to women and children who are victims of trafficking for commercial sexual exploitation.
